description: Sedge (Carex cristatella) is an amazing species of plant. It is often found in low, wet or marshy areas in Scotland and across Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial that brings a stunning dimension to any wetland environment. It provides habitat for small animals and birds, and its bright green leaves with striking white margins are a stunning visual feature. The leaves can be dried and used in floral arrangements and crafts. Its spreading culms have a plethora of uses throughout the year, making it an invaluable addition to any wild garden.
